content: Stadium in Singapore **Jurong East Stadium** is a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) in [Jurong East](/wiki/Jurong_East), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It is currently used mostly for [football](/wiki/Football_(soccer)) matches and is the home stadium of [Albirex Niigata Singapore FC](/wiki/Albirex_Niigata_Singapore_FC) and [Tanjong Pagar United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United). The stadium holds 2,700 people and was opened in 1998. ## Location The stadium is located in [Jurong East](/wiki/Jurong_East), but it is closer to [Chinese Garden MRT station](/wiki/Chinese_Garden_MRT_station). ## History The stadium was built in 1998, and till now, serves as the home stadium for [Albirex Niigata (S)](/wiki/Albirex_Niigata_Singapore_FC). From 2020, [Tanjong Pagar United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United) also uses the stadium as its home stadium. ## Facilities & Structures 1 Field 1 Jogging Track ## Transport The stadium is accessible by [MRT](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)), bus and taxi. Alight at [Chinese Garden MRT station](/wiki/Chinese_Garden_MRT_station) on the [East West Line](/wiki/East_West_MRT_line) to reach the stadium. ## International fixtures DateCompetitionTeamScoreTeamAttendances6 June 2015[Friendly](/wiki/Friendly_(football)) [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)5–1 [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei_national_football_team)1,140 - [List of stadiums in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_stadiums_in_Singapore) 1°20′48″N 103°43′48″E﻿ / ﻿1.34672°N 103.729885°E﻿ / 1.34672; 103.729885 This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e https://www.myactivesg.com/Facilities/jurong-east-stadium
title: Jurong East Stadium
